title: Smells Like Teen Spirit
artistInfo: Nirvana was an American rock band formed in Aberdeen, Washington, in 1987. Founded by lead singer and guitarist Kurt Cobain and bassist Krist Novoselic, the band went through a succession of drummers, most notably Dave Grohl, who joined in 1990. Nirvana is often credited as the band that popularized grunge and alternative rock.
albumInfo: Nevermind is the second studio album by American rock band Nirvana, released on September 24, 1991, by DGC Records. It was Nirvana's first release on a major label and the first to feature drummer Dave Grohl.

history.event: Written by Kurt Cobain, inspired by the Pixies' sound
Released as lead single from Nevermind
Reached #6 on Billboard Hot 100, defining the grunge era

title: Black Hole Sun
artistInfo: Soundgarden was an American rock band formed in Seattle, Washington, in 1984 by singer Chris Cornell, guitarist Kim Thayil, and bassist Hiro Yamamoto. They were one of the seminal bands of the grunge movement.
albumInfo: Superunknown is the fourth studio album by Soundgarden. Released on March 8, 1994, it became the band's breakthrough album and featured their biggest hit singles.

history.event: Written by Chris Cornell after waking from a dream
Released as second single, won Grammy for Best Hard Rock Performance
Music video became MTV staple with surreal imagery

title: Jeremy
artistInfo: Pearl Jam is an American rock band formed in Seattle, Washington, in 1990. The band's lineup consists of Eddie Vedder (vocals), Mike McCready (lead guitar), Stone Gossard (rhythm guitar), Jeff Ament (bass), and Matt Cameron (drums).
albumInfo: Ten is the debut studio album by Pearl Jam, released on August 27, 1991. It has been certified 13x platinum in the United States.

history.event: Written about a real student, Jeremy Wade Delle
Released as third single from Ten
Music video won four MTV Video Music Awards

title: Man in the Box
artistInfo: Alice in Chains is an American rock band from Seattle, Washington, formed in 1987. The band helped develop the grunge genre and is known for their distinctive vocal style featuring harmonies between Layne Staley and Jerry Cantrell.
albumInfo: Facelift is the debut studio album by Alice in Chains, released on August 21, 1990. It was the first grunge album to be certified gold and platinum.

history.event: Written by Jerry Cantrell and Layne Staley
Released as single, became MTV hit
Helped establish Alice in Chains as grunge pioneers

title: Enter Sandman
artistInfo: Metallica is an American heavy metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1981. The band's current lineup comprises founding members James Hetfield (vocals/guitar) and Lars Ulrich (drums), along with Kirk Hammett (guitar) and Robert Trujillo (bass).
albumInfo: Metallica, commonly known as The Black Album, is the fifth studio album by Metallica, released on August 12, 1991. It is one of the best-selling albums worldwide with over 30 million copies sold.

history.event: Kirk Hammett wrote the main riff at 3am
Released as lead single from The Black Album
Became Metallica's signature song and metal anthem

title: Master of Puppets
artistInfo: Metallica is an American heavy metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1981. They are one of the 'Big Four' of thrash metal alongside Megadeth, Anthrax, and Slayer.
albumInfo: Master of Puppets is the third studio album by Metallica, released on March 3, 1986. It is considered one of the greatest and most influential heavy metal albums of all time.

history.event: Written about drug addiction and control
Released as title track of the album
Resurgence in popularity after Stranger Things Season 4

title: Paranoid
artistInfo: Black Sabbath were an English rock band formed in Birmingham in 1968. Widely considered pioneers of heavy metal music, the group consisted of Ozzy Osbourne, Tony Iommi, Geezer Butler, and Bill Ward.
albumInfo: Paranoid is the second studio album by Black Sabbath, released on 18 September 1970. It is often considered one of the greatest and most influential albums in heavy metal history.

history.event: Written in just 20 minutes as a filler track
Released as single, reached #4 in UK
Became one of metal's most recognizable songs

title: Iron Man
artistInfo: Black Sabbath were an English rock band formed in Birmingham in 1968. They are often cited as pioneers of heavy metal music and have sold over 70 million records worldwide.
albumInfo: Paranoid is the second studio album by Black Sabbath. The album has been certified 4x platinum in the US and is considered a landmark in heavy metal.

history.event: Tony Iommi created the iconic main riff
Originally titled 'Iron Bloke' before Ozzy renamed it
Released as single, became signature Black Sabbath song

title: Ace of Spades
artistInfo: Motörhead were an English rock band formed in June 1975 by bassist, singer, and songwriter Lemmy Kilmister. They are often considered a precursor to the new wave of British heavy metal.
albumInfo: Ace of Spades is the fourth studio album by Motörhead, released on 8 November 1980. It is widely considered the band's magnum opus.

history.event: Written about gambling and living on the edge
Released as title track and lead single
Became Motörhead's most famous song

title: Bohemian Rhapsody
artistInfo: Queen are a British rock band formed in London in 1970. The band comprised Freddie Mercury (lead vocals, piano), Brian May (guitar, vocals), Roger Taylor (drums, vocals) and John Deacon (bass).
albumInfo: A Night at the Opera is the fourth studio album by Queen, released on 21 November 1975. It was reportedly the most expensive album ever recorded at the time.

history.event: Recording completed at various studios
Released, featuring the iconic operatic section
Became one of the most celebrated rock songs ever

title: Stairway to Heaven
artistInfo: Led Zeppelin were an English rock band formed in London in 1968. The group consisted of vocalist Robert Plant, guitarist Jimmy Page, bassist John Paul Jones, and drummer John Bonham.
albumInfo: Led Zeppelin IV was released on 8 November 1971. It is one of the best-selling albums worldwide at 37 million copies.

history.event: Jimmy Page began composing the music
Recorded at Headley Grange
Released as part of Led Zeppelin IV

title: Sweet Child O' Mine
artistInfo: Guns N' Roses is an American hard rock band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 1985. The classic lineup featured Axl Rose, Slash, Izzy Stradlin, Duff McKagan, and Steven Adler.
albumInfo: Appetite for Destruction is the debut studio album by Guns N' Roses, released on July 21, 1987. It became the best-selling debut album of all time.

history.event: Written by the band, inspired by Slash's guitar warm-up riff
Recorded for Appetite for Destruction
Reached #1 on Billboard Hot 100

title: Back in Black
artistInfo: AC/DC are an Australian rock band formed in Sydney in 1973 by Scottish-born brothers Malcolm and Angus Young. They are considered pioneers of hard rock and heavy metal.
albumInfo: Back in Black is the seventh studio album by AC/DC, released on 25 July 1980. It is the best-selling album by a band and the second best-selling album of all time.

history.event: Written as tribute to former singer Bon Scott
Released with new singer Brian Johnson
Became one of rock's most iconic songs

title: Highway to Hell
artistInfo: AC/DC are an Australian rock band formed in Sydney in 1973. Known for their energetic performances and iconic guitar riffs, they have sold over 200 million records worldwide.
albumInfo: Highway to Hell is the sixth studio album by AC/DC, released on 27 July 1979. It was the last album to feature lead singer Bon Scott before his death.

history.event: Written about the rigors of touring
Released as title track
Became AC/DC's first album to break US Top 100

title: Creep
artistInfo: Radiohead are an English rock band formed in Abingdon, Oxfordshire, in 1985. The band consists of Thom Yorke, Jonny Greenwood, Ed O'Brien, Colin Greenwood, and Philip Selway.
albumInfo: Pablo Honey is the debut studio album by Radiohead, released on 22 February 1993. The album is known for the breakthrough single 'Creep'.

history.event: Written by the band in the late 1980s
Released as single, initially flopped in UK
Became international hit after US radio play

title: Karma Police
artistInfo: Radiohead are an English rock band known for their experimental approach to rock music. They are considered one of the most influential bands of their generation.
albumInfo: OK Computer is the third studio album by Radiohead, released on 21 May 1997. It is often cited as one of the greatest albums of all time.

history.event: Written during OK Computer sessions
Released as second single from the album
Music video directed by Jonathan Glazer became iconic

title: Losing My Religion
artistInfo: R.E.M. was an American rock band from Athens, Georgia, formed in 1980 by drummer Bill Berry, guitarist Peter Buck, bassist Mike Mills, and lead vocalist Michael Stipe.
albumInfo: Out of Time is the seventh studio album by R.E.M., released on March 12, 1991. It became the band's commercial breakthrough.

history.event: Written by Peter Buck on a mandolin
Released as lead single
Won three Grammy Awards including Best Pop Performance

title: Wonderwall
artistInfo: Oasis were an English rock band formed in Manchester in 1991. The band consisted of Liam Gallagher, Noel Gallagher, Paul Arthurs, Paul McGuigan, and Tony McCarroll.
albumInfo: (What's the Story) Morning Glory? is the second studio album by Oasis, released on 2 October 1995. It became one of the best-selling albums in UK chart history.

history.event: Written by Noel Gallagher about his then-girlfriend
Released as fourth single from the album
Became one of the most covered songs in history

title: Under the Bridge
artistInfo: Red Hot Chili Peppers are an American rock band formed in Los Angeles in 1983. Their music incorporates elements of alternative rock, funk, punk rock, and psychedelic rock.
albumInfo: Blood Sugar Sex Magik is the fifth studio album by Red Hot Chili Peppers, released on September 24, 1991. It is their most commercially successful album.

history.event: Written by Anthony Kiedis about loneliness and drug addiction
Released as second single, reached #2 on Billboard Hot 100
Became band's signature ballad

title: Billie Jean
artistInfo: Michael Joseph Jackson was an American singer, songwriter, and dancer. Dubbed the 'King of Pop', he is regarded as one of the most significant cultural figures of the 20th century.
albumInfo: Thriller is the sixth studio album by Michael Jackson, released on November 30, 1982. It is the best-selling album of all time with estimated sales of 66 million copies.

history.event: Written and composed by Michael Jackson
Released as second single from Thriller
Reached number one on the Billboard Hot 100

title: Beat It
artistInfo: Michael Jackson was known for his contributions to music, dance, and fashion. His videos, including those for 'Beat It' and 'Thriller', are credited with breaking racial barriers on MTV.
albumInfo: Thriller spent nearly 2.5 years on the Billboard 200 chart and won a record-breaking eight Grammy Awards in 1984.

history.event: Written by Jackson with guitar solo by Eddie Van Halen
Released as third single from Thriller
Won two Grammy Awards including Record of the Year

title: Like a Prayer
artistInfo: Madonna Louise Ciccone is an American singer-songwriter and actress. Referred to as the 'Queen of Pop', she is known for pushing the boundaries of artistic expression in mainstream music.
albumInfo: Like a Prayer is the fourth studio album by Madonna, released on March 21, 1989. It received widespread critical acclaim for its artistic depth.

history.event: Written by Madonna and Patrick Leonard
Released as lead single with controversial music video
Reached #1 in over 30 countries

title: Blinding Lights
artistInfo: Abel Makkonen Tesfaye, known as The Weeknd, is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and record producer noted for his unconventional music production and signature falsetto.
albumInfo: After Hours is the fourth studio album by The Weeknd, released on March 20, 2020. It features a 1980s-inspired synth-pop sound.

history.event: Written with Max Martin and Oscar Holter
Released as second single from After Hours
Became longest-charting song in Billboard Hot 100 history

title: Shape of You
artistInfo: Edward Christopher Sheeran is an English singer-songwriter. He began writing songs around age eleven and has sold more than 150 million records worldwide.
albumInfo: ÷ (Divide) is the third studio album by Ed Sheeran, released on March 3, 2017. It debuted at number one in the UK, US, and other major markets.

history.event: Originally written for Rihanna
Released as lead single
Became one of the best-selling digital singles ever

title: Bad Guy
album: When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?
artistInfo: Billie Eilish Pirate Baird O'Connell is an American singer and songwriter. She first gained attention in 2015 with her debut single 'Ocean Eyes'.
albumInfo: When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go? is the debut studio album by Billie Eilish, released on March 29, 2019. It debuted at number one in multiple countries.

history.event: Written and produced with brother Finneas O'Connell
Released as third single from debut album
Won Record of the Year and Song of the Year at Grammy Awards

title: No Scrubs
artistInfo: TLC was an American girl group whose original line-up consisted of Tionne 'T-Boz' Watkins, Lisa 'Left Eye' Lopes, and Rozonda 'Chilli' Thomas.
albumInfo: FanMail is the third studio album by TLC, released on February 23, 1999. It won the Grammy Award for Best R&B Album.

history.event: Written by Kandi Burruss and Kevin 'She'kspere' Briggs
Released as lead single, topped Billboard Hot 100
Became cultural phenomenon and feminist anthem

title: Halo
artistInfo: Beyoncé Giselle Knowles-Carter is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She rose to fame in the late 1990s as the lead singer of Destiny's Child.
albumInfo: I Am... Sasha Fierce is the third studio album by Beyoncé, released on November 18, 2008. It is a double album showcasing two sides of the artist.

history.event: Written by Ryan Tedder and Evan Bogart
Released as fourth single
Won Grammy Award for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance

title: Confessions Part II
artistInfo: Usher Raymond IV is an American singer, songwriter, dancer, and actor. He is one of the best-selling music artists of all time.
albumInfo: Confessions is the fourth studio album by Usher, released on March 23, 2004. It has sold over 20 million copies worldwide.

history.event: Written about personal relationship experiences
Released as fourth single from Confessions
Reached number one on Billboard Hot 100

title: I Will Always Love You
artistInfo: Whitney Elizabeth Houston was an American singer and actress. She is one of the best-selling music artists of all time, with over 200 million records sold worldwide.
albumInfo: The Bodyguard: Original Soundtrack Album was released on November 17, 1992. It became one of the best-selling soundtracks of all time.

history.event: Originally written and recorded by Dolly Parton
Whitney Houston's version released for The Bodyguard
Spent 14 weeks at #1 on Billboard Hot 100

title: Kiss
artistInfo: Prince Rogers Nelson was an American singer-songwriter, musician, and record producer. He was known for his eclectic style, flamboyant stage presence, and wide vocal range.
albumInfo: Parade is the eighth studio album by Prince, released on March 31, 1986. It served as the soundtrack to the film Under the Cherry Moon.

history.event: Originally written for the band Mazarati
Released as lead single from Parade
Became Prince's third US number-one single

title: Killing in the Name
artistInfo: Rage Against the Machine is an American rock band from Los Angeles, California. Known for their blend of rock, hip hop, and politically charged lyrics.
albumInfo: Rage Against the Machine is the debut studio album by the band, released on November 3, 1992. It has been certified triple platinum in the US.

history.event: Written about police brutality and institutional racism
Released as part of debut album
Became UK Christmas number one after internet campaign

title: Chop Suey!
artistInfo: System of a Down is an Armenian-American heavy metal band from Glendale, California. They are known for their unique style that blends metal with Armenian folk music.
albumInfo: Toxicity is the second studio album by System of a Down, released on September 4, 2001. It debuted at number one on the Billboard 200.

history.event: Written about self-righteous suicide
Released as lead single from Toxicity
Became band's breakthrough hit worldwide

title: Take Five
artistInfo: The Dave Brubeck Quartet was an American jazz group led by pianist Dave Brubeck. The classic quartet featured Paul Desmond on alto saxophone.
albumInfo: Time Out is a jazz album by the Dave Brubeck Quartet, released in 1959. It was the first jazz album to sell over a million copies.

history.event: Written by Paul Desmond in 5/4 time signature
Recorded for Time Out album
Released as single, became unlikely hit

title: So What
artistInfo: Miles Dewey Davis III was an American trumpeter, bandleader, and composer. He is among the most influential and acclaimed figures in the history of jazz and 20th-century music.
albumInfo: Kind of Blue is a studio album by Miles Davis, released on August 17, 1959. It is the best-selling jazz record of all time.

history.event: Based on modal jazz scales rather than chord changes
Recorded in just two sessions
Became one of the most influential jazz recordings ever

title: A Love Supreme
artistInfo: John William Coltrane was an American jazz saxophonist, bandleader, and composer. He is among the most influential and acclaimed figures in jazz history.
albumInfo: A Love Supreme is a studio album by John Coltrane, released in 1965. It is considered one of the greatest jazz albums ever recorded.

history.event: Written as spiritual devotion and musical prayer
Recorded in one session
Released to critical acclaim and commercial success

title: Fly Me to the Moon
album: It Might as Well Be Swing
artistInfo: Francis Albert Sinatra was an American singer and actor. Nicknamed 'The Chairman of the Board', he is considered one of the greatest singers of all time.
albumInfo: It Might as Well Be Swing is an album by Frank Sinatra with Count Basie and his orchestra, released in 1964.

history.event: Written by Bart Howard as 'In Other Words'
Sinatra's version arranged by Quincy Jones
Played during Apollo 11 moon landing

title: What a Wonderful World
artistInfo: Louis Daniel Armstrong was an American trumpeter and vocalist. His career spanned five decades and had a profound influence on jazz.
albumInfo: What a Wonderful World is an album by Louis Armstrong, released in 1968. The title track became one of his most beloved recordings.

history.event: Written by Bob Thiele and George David Weiss
Initially a flop in US but hit in UK
Gained new popularity after use in Good Morning, Vietnam

title: Lose Yourself
artistInfo: Marshall Bruce Mathers III, known as Eminem, is an American rapper, songwriter, and record producer. He is cited as one of the greatest and most influential rappers of all time.
albumInfo: Music from and Inspired by the Motion Picture 8 Mile is the soundtrack album for the 2002 film 8 Mile.

history.event: Written on set of 8 Mile movie
Released as lead single from soundtrack
Won Academy Award for Best Original Song

title: Stan
artistInfo: Eminem is known for his controversies and lyrical ability. His alter ego Slim Shady has been a recurring persona throughout his career.
albumInfo: The Marshall Mathers LP is the third studio album by Eminem, released on May 23, 2000. It is one of the fastest-selling albums in US history.

history.event: Written about obsessive fandom and its consequences
Features interpolation of Dido's 'Thank You'
'Stan' became slang term for obsessive fan

title: Juicy
artistInfo: Christopher George Latore Wallace, known as The Notorious B.I.G. or Biggie Smalls, was an American rapper widely considered one of the greatest rappers of all time.
albumInfo: Ready to Die is the debut studio album by The Notorious B.I.G., released on September 13, 1994. It is considered one of the greatest hip-hop albums ever.

history.event: Written as autobiographical rags-to-riches story
Released as debut single
Became hip-hop anthem and cultural touchstone

title: N.Y. State of Mind
artistInfo: Nasir bin Olu Dara Jones, known as Nas, is an American rapper and songwriter. He is considered one of the greatest and most influential MCs of all time.
albumInfo: Illmatic is the debut studio album by Nas, released on April 19, 1994. It is widely regarded as one of the greatest hip-hop albums ever made.

history.event: Produced by DJ Premier with immediate impact
Released as part of Illmatic
Considered pinnacle of East Coast hip-hop lyricism

title: Nuthin' but a 'G' Thang
artistInfo: Andre Romelle Young, known as Dr. Dre, is an American rapper, record producer, and entrepreneur. He is credited as a key figure in the popularization of West Coast G-funk.
albumInfo: The Chronic is the debut solo studio album by Dr. Dre, released on December 15, 1992. It redefined West Coast hip-hop and launched several careers.

history.event: Written with Snoop Dogg, who was introduced on this track
Released as lead single from The Chronic
Reached #2 on Billboard Hot 100

title: HUMBLE.
artistInfo: Kendrick Lamar Duckworth is an American rapper and songwriter. He is widely regarded as one of the most influential rappers of his generation.
albumInfo: DAMN. is the fourth studio album by Kendrick Lamar, released on April 14, 2017. It won the Pulitzer Prize for Music in 2018.

history.event: Produced by Mike WiLL Made-It
Released as lead single from DAMN.
Won Grammy for Best Rap Song and Best Rap Performance

title: Sicko Mode
artistInfo: Jacques Berman Webster II, known as Travis Scott, is an American rapper, singer, and record producer known for his atmospheric production style.
albumInfo: Astroworld is the third studio album by Travis Scott, released on August 3, 2018. It debuted at number one on the Billboard 200.

history.event: Features Drake and multiple beat switches
Released as part of Astroworld
Reached #1 on Billboard Hot 100

title: Summertime
artist: DJ Jazzy Jeff & The Fresh Prince
artistInfo: DJ Jazzy Jeff & The Fresh Prince was an American hip-hop duo consisting of DJ Jazzy Jeff and Will Smith (The Fresh Prince).
albumInfo: Homebase is the fourth studio album by DJ Jazzy Jeff & The Fresh Prince, released in 1991. It marked a more mature sound for the duo.

history.event: Written as nostalgic summer anthem
Released as lead single from Homebase
Won Grammy for Best Rap Performance by a Duo or Group

title: Around the World
artistInfo: Daft Punk was a French electronic music duo consisting of Thomas Bangalter and Guy-Manuel de Homem-Christo. They are pioneers of French house music.
albumInfo: Homework is the debut studio album by Daft Punk, released on January 20, 1997. It is considered a landmark in electronic and house music.

history.event: Written with repetitive hook sung 144 times
Released as second single from Homework
Music video by Michel Gondry became iconic

title: Get Lucky
artistInfo: Daft Punk are known for their visual stylization and disguises, appearing in public wearing robot helmets and gloves.
albumInfo: Random Access Memories is the fourth studio album by Daft Punk, released on May 17, 2013. It won Album of the Year at the 2014 Grammy Awards.

history.event: Written with Pharrell Williams and Nile Rodgers
Released as lead single
Won Grammy Awards for Record of the Year and Best Pop Duo/Group Performance

title: Sandstorm
artistInfo: Ville Virtanen, known by his stage name Darude, is a Finnish DJ and record producer best known for his platinum-selling single 'Sandstorm'.
albumInfo: Before the Storm is the debut studio album by Darude, released in 2000. It features the worldwide hit 'Sandstorm'.

history.event: Written as instrumental trance track
Released in Finland, becoming instant hit
Became internet meme and sports stadium anthem

title: Levels
artistInfo: Tim Bergling, known professionally as Avicii, was a Swedish DJ, remixer, and record producer. He is considered one of the most influential artists in electronic dance music.
albumInfo: Levels was released as a single in 2011 and later included on various compilations. It became Avicii's breakthrough hit.

history.event: Written with Etta James vocal sample
Released as single
Reached top 10 in multiple countries worldwide

title: Titanium
artistInfo: Pierre David Guetta is a French DJ and record producer. He has sold over 50 million records worldwide and has been named the number one DJ by DJ Mag.
albumInfo: Nothing but the Beat is the fifth studio album by David Guetta, released on August 26, 2011. It featured multiple chart-topping singles.

history.event: Written by Sia, originally intended for Alicia Keys
Released as fourth single from album
Reached #1 in multiple countries

title: Strobe
album: For Lack of a Better Name
artistInfo: Joel Thomas Zimmerman, known professionally as Deadmau5, is a Canadian electronic music producer and DJ known for his progressive house and techno.
albumInfo: For Lack of a Better Name is the fourth studio album by Deadmau5, released on September 22, 2009.

history.event: Written as 10-minute progressive house epic
Released as part of For Lack of a Better Name
Considered one of the greatest electronic tracks ever made

title: Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites
album: Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites EP
artistInfo: Sonny John Moore, known professionally as Skrillex, is an American DJ and record producer. He is credited with popularizing dubstep in America.
albumInfo: Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites is the second extended play by Skrillex, released on October 22, 2010. It brought dubstep into the mainstream.

history.event: Written with aggressive dubstep drops
Released as title track of EP
Won Grammy Awards for Best Dance Recording and Best Dance/Electronica Album

title: Blue Monday
artistInfo: New Order are an English rock band formed in Manchester in 1980. They emerged from the remains of Joy Division following the suicide of singer Ian Curtis.
albumInfo: Blue Monday was released as a single in 1983. It is the best-selling 12-inch single of all time.

history.event: Written with pioneering use of sequencers and drum machines
Released as single with iconic Peter Saville sleeve
Became influential electronic dance track

title: One More Time
artistInfo: Daft Punk achieved critical and commercial success with their albums Homework and Discovery, helping to popularize French house.
albumInfo: Discovery is the second studio album by Daft Punk, released on March 12, 2001. It was accompanied by the anime film Interstella 5555.

history.event: Written with heavily compressed and filtered vocals
Released as lead single from Discovery
Became club anthem and Daft Punk's most successful single

title: Uptown Funk
artistInfo: Mark Daniel Ronson is a British-American DJ, songwriter, and record producer. Bruno Mars is an American singer-songwriter known for his retro style.
albumInfo: Uptown Special is the fourth studio album by Mark Ronson, released on January 13, 2015. It features collaborations with various artists.

history.event: Written over several sessions spanning a year
Released as lead single
Spent 14 weeks at #1 on Billboard Hot 100

title: Rolling in the Deep
artistInfo: Adele Laurie Blue Adkins is an English singer-songwriter known for her powerful vocals and emotional ballads.
albumInfo: 21 is the second studio album by Adele, released on January 24, 2011. It has sold over 31 million copies worldwide.

history.event: Written after end of relationship
Released as lead single from 21
Won Grammy Awards for Record of the Year, Song of the Year, and Best Short Form Music Video

title: Someone Like You
artistInfo: Adele is one of the world's best-selling music artists, with sales of over 120 million records.
albumInfo: 21 spent 24 weeks at number one on the Billboard 200, the longest for any album since 1993.

history.event: Written with Dan Wilson about acceptance of a breakup
Released as second single from 21
Iconic Brit Awards performance brought song to international attention

title: Take On Me
artistInfo: a-ha is a Norwegian synth-pop band formed in Oslo in 1982. The band consists of Morten Harket (vocals), Magne Furuholmen (keyboards), and Pål Waaktaar-Savoy (guitars).
albumInfo: Hunting High and Low is the debut studio album by a-ha, released on June 1, 1985. It has sold over 11 million copies worldwide.

history.event: Originally released but failed to chart
Re-released with groundbreaking rotoscoped music video
Reached #1 on Billboard Hot 100

title: Girls Just Want to Have Fun
artistInfo: Cynthia Ann Stephanie Lauper is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She is known for her distinctive image and powerful vocals.
albumInfo: She's So Unusual is the debut solo studio album by Cyndi Lauper, released on October 14, 1983. She became the first female artist to have four top-five singles from a debut album.

history.event: Originally written by Robert Hazard with different lyrics
Lauper rewrote lyrics from female perspective
Became feminist anthem and cultural touchstone

title: No Diggity
artistInfo: Blackstreet was an American R&B group formed by Teddy Riley in 1991. They were prominent figures in the new jack swing and R&B genres.
albumInfo: Another Level is the second studio album by Blackstreet, released on September 10, 1996. It is the group's most successful album.

history.event: Written with Dr. Dre and Queen Pen feature
Released as lead single
Spent four weeks at #1 on Billboard Hot 100

title: Waterfalls
artistInfo: TLC is one of the best-selling girl groups of all time, known for addressing social issues in their music.
albumInfo: CrazySexyCool is the second studio album by TLC, released on November 15, 1994. It has been certified diamond in the US.

history.event: Written about AIDS and drug dealing
Released as third single from CrazySexyCool
Spent seven weeks at #1 on Billboard Hot 100

title: Crazy in Love
artistInfo: Beyoncé launched her solo career in 2003 after the hiatus of Destiny's Child, becoming one of the best-selling music artists of all time.
albumInfo: Dangerously in Love is the debut solo studio album by Beyoncé, released on June 24, 2003. It debuted at number one on the Billboard 200.

history.event: Written with Rich Harrison using Chi-Lites horn sample
Released as lead single
Won Grammy for Best R&B Song and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration

title: Yeah!
artistInfo: Usher has won eight Grammy Awards and has sold over 80 million records worldwide.
albumInfo: Confessions spent nine non-consecutive weeks at number one and has sold over 10 million copies in the US alone.

history.event: Written with Lil Jon's signature crunk production style
Released as lead single from Confessions
Spent 12 weeks at #1 on Billboard Hot 100

title: Come Together
artistInfo: The Beatles were an English rock band formed in Liverpool in 1960. They are considered the most influential band of all time.
albumInfo: Abbey Road is the eleventh studio album by the Beatles, released on 26 September 1969. It features the iconic zebra crossing cover.

history.event: Written by John Lennon, originally for Timothy Leary's political campaign
Released as double A-side single with 'Something'
Reached #1 in multiple countries

title: Hotel California
artistInfo: The Eagles are an American rock band formed in Los Angeles in 1971. They are one of the world's best-selling bands of all time.
albumInfo: Hotel California is the fifth studio album by the Eagles, released on December 8, 1976. It is one of the best-selling albums of all time.

history.event: Written as commentary on American excess and hedonism
Released as single
Won Grammy for Record of the Year

title: Comfortably Numb
artistInfo: Pink Floyd were an English rock band formed in London in 1965. They achieved international acclaim with their progressive and psychedelic music.
albumInfo: The Wall is the eleventh studio album by Pink Floyd, released on 30 November 1979. It is a rock opera about self-imposed isolation.

history.event: Written by Roger Waters and David Gilmour
Features one of rock's greatest guitar solos
Consistently voted one of the greatest songs ever

title: Smells Like Teen Spirit
artistInfo: Nirvana was an American rock band formed in Aberdeen, Washington, in 1987.
albumInfo: Nevermind has sold over 30 million copies worldwide.

history.event: Changed music landscape overnight

title: November Rain
artistInfo: Guns N' Roses are an American hard rock band known for their explosive live performances and hard-living lifestyle.
albumInfo: Use Your Illusion I is the third studio album by Guns N' Roses, released on September 17, 1991.

history.event: Written by Axl Rose, based on an earlier composition
Released as single with epic music video
Became one of the most expensive music videos ever made

title: Purple Haze
artistInfo: James Marshall Hendrix was an American guitarist, singer, and songwriter. He is widely regarded as one of the most influential guitarists in history.
albumInfo: Are You Experienced is the debut studio album by the Jimi Hendrix Experience, released in 1967.

history.event: Written allegedly about a vivid dream
Released as single in UK
Became psychedelic rock anthem

title: Whole Lotta Love
artistInfo: Led Zeppelin are widely considered one of the greatest and most influential rock bands in history.
albumInfo: Led Zeppelin II is the second studio album by Led Zeppelin, released on 22 October 1969.

history.event: Written during first US tour
Released as part of Led Zeppelin II
Features one of rock's most recognizable riffs

title: In the End
artistInfo: Linkin Park is an American rock band from Agoura Hills, California. They pioneered the nu-metal and alternative rock genres in the 2000s.
albumInfo: Hybrid Theory is the debut studio album by Linkin Park, released on October 24, 2000. It is one of the best-selling debut albums of all time.

history.event: Written about frustration and futility
Released as fourth single
Became defining song of early 2000s rock

title: Numb
artistInfo: Linkin Park achieved mainstream success with Hybrid Theory and Meteora, which combined elements of rock with hip hop.
albumInfo: Meteora is the second studio album by Linkin Park, released on March 25, 2003. It debuted at number one on the Billboard 200.

history.event: Written about pressure to conform
Released as third single from Meteora
Became one of the band's most popular songs

title: Mr. Brightside
artistInfo: The Killers are an American rock band formed in Las Vegas in 2001. The band consists of Brandon Flowers, Dave Keuning, Mark Stoermer, and Ronnie Vannucci Jr.
albumInfo: Hot Fuss is the debut studio album by The Killers, released on June 7, 2004. It has sold over 7 million copies worldwide.

history.event: Written by Brandon Flowers about jealousy
One of the first songs written by the band
Has spent over 300 weeks on UK Singles Chart

title: Seven Nation Army
artistInfo: The White Stripes were an American rock duo formed in Detroit in 1997. The duo consisted of Jack White and Meg White.
albumInfo: Elephant is the fourth studio album by The White Stripes, released on April 1, 2003. It won the Grammy Award for Best Alternative Music Album.

history.event: Written with instantly recognizable bass-like guitar riff
Released as lead single from Elephant
Riff became famous sports stadium chant worldwide

title: Clint Eastwood
artistInfo: Gorillaz are a British virtual band created in 1998 by musician Damon Albarn and artist Jamie Hewlett. The band consists of four animated members.
albumInfo: Gorillaz is the debut studio album by Gorillaz, released on 26 March 2001. It helped pioneer the concept of a virtual band.

history.event: Written with Del the Funky Homosapien rap verses
Released as lead single
Introduced world to animated band concept
